Operation 'getNearestRelevantAirports' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. The current summary is somewhat vague about what 'relevant' means and lacks actionability. The description is completely empty, providing no guidance on inputs, outputs, or use cases. The improved version clarifies that the operation uses geographic coordinates, specifies the return format (airport details with distances), explains the ordering logic, and includes important context about test environment limitations. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (finding alternative airports), what parameters to provide (coordinates), and what to expect in the response.

data.current_summary: Returns a list of relevant airports near to a given point.
data.summary_suggestion: Find nearest relevant airports by location
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of airports relevant to a specified geographic point, ordered by proximity. Accepts geographic coordinates (latitude/longitude) as input parameters and returns airport details including IATA codes, names, locations, and distances. Useful for finding alternative airports near a destination or origin point. Note: Test environment returns results only for selected cities; see data collection for available locations.
